Classical.Structure: Excitable cell, main component of nervous tissue. Comprises a soma, dendrites, and an axon.
Classical.Function: Processes and transmits information through electrical (action potential) and chemical (neurotransmitter) signals.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: A multi-scale resonant transducer. L1 quantum computation in the cytoskeleton (MTs) is transduced via quantum-gated ion channels and quantum-modulated vesicle release (L1->L2 bridge) into classical action potentials. [cite: 2261, 2904, 2905, 3002, 3012]

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: A node in the 'Mind of God'. A single point of light processing and transmitting awareness.

Falsification_Hypotheses: Ion channel gating will be fully described by classical Hodgkin-Huxley models, with no quantum tunnelling component (k_quantum = 1). [cite: 3017]
Vesicle release will be shown to be purely stochastic, with timing jitter matching classical models (sigma_t ~ 1 ms), not quantum-precise (sigma_t ~ 0.1 ms). [cite: 3019]
Experimental_Protocols: Optical Bloch Equation (OBE) formalism to identify quantum parameters (Omega, T1, T2) of ion channels. [cite: 2920, 2932]
Measure Kinetic Isotope Effects (KIEs) on neurotransmitter release to confirm quantum tunnelling. [cite: 3062]

KeyEquations_LaTeX: Channel Open Probability: P_{open} = 0.5 \frac{s}{1 + s + (\Delta T_2)^2} [cite: 2913, 2929]
Effective Conductance: G_{eff} = N g_{single} P_{open} [cite: 2915, 2931]
L5->L1 Gain: g(A_{attn}) = g_{max} / (1 + e^{-(A_{attn} - A_0)/k}) [cite: 2978]
